result.execSummary:
All charges against Mikaela R Skiba in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mikaela R Skiba is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mikaela R Skiba

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Motion Hearing held April 27, 2022

03:52 PM Defendant Mikaela R Skiba in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for De Novo on Defense's Motion ot Dismiss.
Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court orders this case dismissed without prejudice.
Order Sealing Exhibits 1-9 to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Complaint signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on March 15, 2022.
Motion hearing on April 27, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 03/04/2022:   If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:43 AM Defendant Ryan A Skiba in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Michael Thurston and Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court calls the matter for the Defense's Motion to Dismiss.
ADA Woller brings up the matter of a possible conflict with attorney Levine representing both clients. 
Attorney Levine states he has discussed the possible conflict with his clients and will file a waiver and would like to proceed. 
ADA Woller presents counter statements. 
The Court will proceed, however once it gets to the Trial Court requests ADA Woller to bring up conflict again.
Attorney Levine presents arguments and requests the Court to dismiss the case.
ADA Woller presents arguments and requests the Court to deny the Defense's Motion to Dismiss.
Attorney Levine presents counter arguments.
The Court puts its findings on the record.
The Court denies the Defense's Motion to Dismiss. 
De Novo rights given. 
Attorney Levine requests to set the matter before the Trial Court.
The Court will adjourn to the Trial Court. 
Preliminary time limits previously waived.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Exhibit 1 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 6 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 5 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 4 filed by  Atty Levine
Exhibit 9 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 7 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 2 filed
Exhibit 6 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 3 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 8 filed by Atty Levine
Exhibit 6 filed by Atty Levine
Motion to seal exhibits 1-9
Motion to seal exhibits filed by Atty Michael Levine
to dismiss complaint filed by Defense attorney, Michael Levine. Sent to CC Costello for review
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:22 AM Defendant Mikaela R Skiba in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense requests an adjourn initial appearance.
The State presents statements.
The Court denies the request and will proceed.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.   
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Defense states it will be filing a motion to dismiss.
The Court orders Defense to fill the motion to dismiss one week prior to the prelim hearing.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
